Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute undersanding: {color: black}
Template:
A/An {color} {object}.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: {color-1: red} {color-2: green}
Template:
A/An {color-1} {object-1} and a/an {color-2} {object-2}.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: {color: blue} border
Template:
A/An {object} with a/an {color} border.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: {color: yellow}, different color
Template:
A/An {color} {object} with the border of a different color.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: {color: orange}
Template: A circle with its radius marked in {color}.

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: large, small
Template: A large {object} and a small one.

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: different size
Template:
Some {object-plural} of different sizes.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: thick\thin
Template: The diagonal of the square is {color} and very thick.

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: rounded corners
Template:
A/An {object} with rounded corners.
Restriction: the object is a polygon

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: equal length
Template:
A/An {object} with sides of equal length.
Restriction: object in ['quadrilateral', 'pentagon', 'hexagon', 'octagon']

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: different sizes, largest one, {color: red}
Template:
Some {object-plural} of different sizes and mark the largest one in {color}.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: attribute understanding: longer than
Template: A/an {object} and its shadow which is longer than it.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 2}, {number: 5}
Template: There are {number-1} {object-1-plural} and {number-2} {object-2-plural}.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 2}, {number: 5} more objects
Template:
The number of triangles is {number}, and there are {number} more {object-plural} than triangles.
Restriction: object is 2D

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 3} sides
Template:
A polygon with {number} sides.
Restriction: number = 3+N

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: [matrix dimension] {number: three} by {number: four}
Template: A {number}-by-{number} matrix.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: integer M > N, M > 1 & N>1
Template: M {object-1-plural} and N {object-2-plural}, where M is greater than N, and M and N are both larger than 1.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: integer M = N, M > 2,  N>2
Template: M {object-1-plural} and N {object-2-plural}, where M is the same as N, and M and N are both larger than 2.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: function, inverse function
Template: y = {number}^{x} and its inverse function.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number : 3} *N, N>1
Template: There are N {object-1-plural} and {number}*N {object-2-plural}, where N > 1.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 4} sides, [fraction] 1/{number: 2}
Template: A rectangle with a length of {number} cm and a width of 1/{number} of the length.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: integer N, N-1, N>2
Template:
A/An {object} is divided into N parts using N-1 lines, where N > 2.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 30} %
Template:
In the pie chart, the proportion of children is {number}%, and the rest are adults.
Restriction: number  = 10*N

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: M+N+K={number: 30}
Template:
A bar chart representing weather distribution, with M sunny days, N rainy days, and K cloudy days, where M + N + K equals {number}.
Restriction: number = N+10

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 7} nodes
Template:
A binary tree with a total of {number} nodes.
Restriction: number = 3 + N

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical understanding: {number: 4} hidden layers
Template: There is an artificial neural network with {number} hidden layers.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical reasoning: numbers in pie/bar chart
Template: A {bar chart} shows the number of graduates in different subjects within the community. {number} studied humanities, {number} studied science, and {number} studied engineering. The values are marked at the top of each bar./The percentages are marked inside each pie slice.

Reasoning Type Annotation: numerical reasoning: numbers in bar chart/ line chart/ dot plot
Template: The number of students at the university was {number} in 2020, {number} in 2021, {number} in 2022, and {number} in 2023. The student numbers over these four years are represented in a {line chart/ bar chart/ dot plot}. The values are also marked in the chart.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: {preposition: in the middle of}
Template:
A/An {object} is {preposition} the canvas.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: {preposition: to the left of}
Template: A/An {object} is to the left of a/an {object}.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: {spatial_adj: upper left}
Template:
There is a/an {2D-object} in the {spatial_adj} corner of a square.
Restriction: spatial_adj in ['upper left', 'upper right', 'lower left', 'lower right']

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: each corner of a polygon
Template:
A/An {object} in each corner of a polygon.
Restriction: object is 2D

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: inside, outside
Template: A/An {object} is inside the {object}, and a/an {object} is outside.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: between A and B
Template:
A/An {object-1} between a/an {object-2} and a/an {object-3}.
Restriction: object is 2D or 3D

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: {spatial_adj: leftmost}

A binary tree with the root at the {spatial_adj} position.
Restriction: spatial_adj in ['leftmost', 'rightmost', 'top', 'bottom']

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: {spatial_adv: upwards}
Template:
A parabola opening {spatial_adv}. 
Restriction: spatial_adv in ['upwards', 'downwards', 'towards the left', 'towards the right']

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: intersect
Template: A/An {2D-object-1} and a/an {2D-object-2} intersect.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: around
Template:
There are many {object-plural} around a/an {object}.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: embedded, without intersection

Many {object-plural} are embedded within each other without intersection.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: parabola trace

The {object} moves along a parabola.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial understanding: half-filled water
Template:
A/an {object} is half filled with water.
Restriction: object is a container.

Reasoning Type Annotation: spatial reasoning: on, top view, left view, left side of the image, right side of the image, beside
Template: There is a {object} on the table. The {object} and the table are on the left side of the image. The top view and the left view of the {object} are on the right side of the image, and the English texts of 'top view' and 'left view' are annotated beside their shapes.

{number} {color} {3D-obejct-1-plural} are placed {preposition} a {3D-object-2}.
{number} {object-plural} are aligned in a row; the first one is {color-1}, and the others are {color-2}.
{number} parallel line segments are inside a circle, with all of their endpoints on the circle. Mark the endpoints with {color} dots.
Two lines divide the dots into three clusters. Mark the {spatial_adj} cluster in {color-1}, the middle cluster in {color-2}, and the last one in {color-3}.

{number} {2D-object-plural} are placed in a coordinate system and are symmetrical about the origin. Object(s) on the one side is/are in {color-1}. Object(s) on the other side is/are in {color-2}.
Restriction: number = 2* N
Some {object-plural} are on opposite sides of a plane. There are {number-1} {color-1} ones on the left and {number-2} {color-2} ones on the right.
A line graph with {number-1} {color-1} lines increasing gradually and intersecting once, and {number-2} {color-2} lines decreasing gradually without intersecting the other lines.
A bar chart with {number} bars and mark the leftmost bar in {color}.
{number} {color-1} straight lines are not parallel to each other. They pass through a {color-2} plane and form the same angle with the plane.

{number} {straight} lines are located in a coordinate system and are symmetrical about the X-axis in pairs. Each pairs share the same color.
Restriction: number = 2*N
A small ball falls from a table 1.{number} meters high and bounces to a height of 0.{number} meters. The trajectory of the ball's fall and rebound is represented by a/an {color} dotted line.
The box on the left contains {number} white balls, and the box on the right contains {number} {color-1} balls and {number} {color-2} balls.
